Mass. to review pension holdings in weapons firms

Making 600 anolini a family tradition

Anolini in brodo is a simple dish -- just stuffed pasta in clear broth. For Al Botti, 88, and his niece, its success lies in the quality of ingredients and the care taken during preparation. (Globe)

Green Line train partially derails at Packard's Corner stop in Allston

A Green Line train partially derailed last night as it pulled into the Packard’s Corner station in Allston, an MBTA spokesman said. No passengers were hurt. (Globe)

Opinion | Brian McGrory

After Newtown shootings,
now is time for change

This country has lost its way on guns, completely and horrifyingly so. Now, though, from the utter devastation of Newtown, we have the first hints of change.

If you’re holding out for a Christmas Eve shopping spree on the theory discounts will be plentiful, think again.

Some decide they won’t shop at all

A new report reveals that nearly one in five Americans will do no holiday shopping at all this year.
Opinion | Scot Lehigh

In replacing Kerry, dare to be fair

If John Kerry becomes secretary of state, Governor Patrick should appoint an interim senator who pledges not to run for the job.

Fiscal offer gives Democrats pause

Democrats are unhappy that President Obama is entertaining the idea of trimming the size of future Social Security payments as part of a budget deal.
Opinion | Jeff Jacoby

Good laws will never abolish evil

No regulation or reform can prevent all homicidal insanity, and still less can legislation guarantee universal integrity and decent character.

Bay State gas prices falling slowly

The numbers at Mass. gas pumps have ticked down steadily over the past two months, but don’t count on paying Missouri prices here any time soon.
